quotes.quote: Those base men who speak of the secret faults of others destroy themselves like serpents that stray onto anthills.
Pain is always a fanged serpent, but to the fearful it has a hundred heads.
The crookedness of the serpent is still straight enough to slide through the snake hole.
Those who give you a serpent when you ask for a fish, may have nothing but serpents to give.
Be wise as a serpent and wary as a dove!
The mediation by the serpent was necessary. Evil can seduce man, but cannot become man.
The serpent is helpless unless he finds an apple to work with.
A serpent is a serpent, and none the less a viper, because it is nestled in the bosom of an honest-hearted man.
Adam blamed Eve, Eve blamed the serpent and the serpent didn't have a leg to stand on.
If a man is as wise as a serpent, he can afford to be as harmless as a dove.
Eternity is a circle, a serpent that swallows its own tail.
An arrow may fly through the air and leave no trace; but an ill thought leaves a trail like a serpent.
That crafty kindness which inveigles me to sacrifice principle is the serpent in the grass -- deadly to the incautious wayfarer.
The fiercest serpent may be overcome by a swarm of ants.
To fight the raven you may make alliance with the serpent until the battle is done.
Look like the innocent flower, But be the serpent under it.
We must combine the toughness of the serpent with the softness of the dove, a tough mind and a tender heart.
Unless a serpent devour a serpent it will not become a dragon. Unless one power absorb another, it will not become great.
Knowledge hath in it somewhat of the serpent, and therefore where it entereth into a man it makes him swell.
Still anyone who trusts a serpent deserves its bite. The wise see a creature for what it is, not what it says it may be.
Judge nothing by the appearance. The more beautiful the serpent, the more fatal its sting.
The trail of the human serpent is thus over everything.
Do not trust a malicious man because you have long been intimate with him. A serpent will still bite, though it may have been kept and tended a long time.
If a man wishes to become a hero, then the serpent must first become a dragon: otherwise he lacks his proper enemy.
Beware the serpent, slyly hid, which stings; The soul with poison of Prosperity.
Better a serpent than a stepmother!
We were ensnared by the wisdom of the serpent; we are set free by the foolishness of God.
How sharper than a serpent's tooth it is to have a thankless child!
Those who tread among serpents, and along a tortuous path, must use the cunning of the serpent.
The infernal serpent; he it was, whose guile, Stirr'd up with envy and revenge, deceiv'd the mother of mankind.
